result.execSummary:
The defendant Angela M. Chamberlain was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay the DNA surcharge, and to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department as is required in all criminal convictions.  Defendant is granted to add costs to current payment plan if current payment plan is reinstated.  Defendant is allowed to work off costs if a program exists in Clark County.
Defendant is granted huber privileges.  Defendant was granted 90 days credit for time served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angela M. Chamberlain

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Bond returned by Sherrif's Department unsigned / not posted.
Response/Reply-Defendant requested a payment plan -For this case ONLY granted $50/month starting 01-08-2015

Prosecutor Lyndsey A.B. Brunette and Defendant, Angela M. Chamberlain, in custody, appeared with Attorney Christine Kuczynski.   Defendant enters a no contest plea to the charge, Count 1.   Defendant has no objection to Court appearing by video for this Sentencing. Court finds defendant guilty of charge.  Court orders 7 months in the Clark County Jail with huber privileges, 90 days credit for time served, Costs, DNA sample, 60 days to pay, this may be added to defendant's payment plan if it is reinstated.  Court does allow for defendant to work off fines if allowed in Clark County.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person via video conference from Clark County Jail with Attorney Christine Kuczynski appearing in person in court    Defendant acknowledged receipt of complaint.  The defense waived reading of the complaint and stood mute to the charges.  BASED ON THE DEFENDANT STANDING MUTE,THE COURT ENTERED A NOT GUILTY PLEA ON BEHALF OF THE DEFENDANT

The defendant shall have no contact with M.J.B. of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way.  Defendant is not to have any access to or use any checking accounts including her own.

District Attorney Lyndsey A Boon Brunette appeared on behalf of the State;  Defendant appeared in person, pro se,  via video conference from Clark County Jail  Defendant advised of right to an attorney  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 02:10 pm.
